parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.08</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Identity </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets the name of a location or a person. In Arma 3 this can be used to set [[name]] of a person but only in single player. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object '''setName''' name </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> name: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value>[[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> unit '''setName''' [name, firstName, lastName] </value></part><part><name>Alternative Syntax</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>
 </value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> [name, firstName, lastName]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> name: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER23</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p24</name>=<value> firstName: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER24</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p25</name>=<value> lastName: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER25</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>s3</name>=<value> location '''setName''' name </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p31</name>=<value> location: [[Location]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER31</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p32</name>=<value> name: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER32</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r3</name>=<value>[[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE3</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>myLocation [[setName]] "My Location Name";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[setName]] "New Name";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[setName]] ["Ben Kerry","Ben","Kerry"];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[name]], [[nameSound]], [[setNameSound]], [[setIdentity]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 9, 2010‎
<dt class="note">[[User:kju|kju]]
<dd class="note">Appears to be only for the 3d editor.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on September 19, 2013‎
<dt class="note">[[User:Druid|Druid]]
<dd class="note">Support of a person as the first parameter from Arma 3 v. 1.02.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 12, 2014
<dt class="note">[[User:Waffle SS.|Waffle SS.]]
<dd class="note">Seems to have no effect on players in Multiplayer. (Arma 3 v1.00)

<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 18, 2014
<dt class="note">[[User:Pierre MGI|Pierre MGI]]
<dd class="note">Only last name will appear in command bar i.e. this setname _mynameArray will display _mynameArray select 2. If setname is used with a string : this setname "blah", nothing occurs in command bar and default randomized name is displayed.
<br><br>
Dealing with the units' names in a script, _x (in a foreach units group, for example) will return the "object" as B ALFA 4-1:2 or the name written in ai unit name field in editor (if exists). This context is rather a "variable name" for each object (ai) than an "identity name" as given via setname function.
<BR><BR>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<h3 style="display:none">Bottom Section</h3>
